medium_description_en: Calculates free water deficit by estimated total body water.
short_description_en: Free water deficit by estimated total body water.

seo.meta_description_en: The Free Water Deficit in Hypernatremia calculates free water deficit by estimated total body water.
seo.keywords_en: Free Water Deficit Hypernatremia, FW deficit, FW hypernatremia, Free water, free water deficit, free water hypernatremia, hypernatremia fw calc, fw calc, free water calc, free water hypernatremia calc, hypernatremia, hypernatremia online calc, FW deficit online, free water total water, free h2o, free h2o calc

how_to_use.pearls_pitfalls_en: This tool provides an estimate of free water deficit based on a patient's body weight; this can be incorrect in patients with signfiicant weight gain or loss (especially from fluid sources).

next_steps.advice_en: After determining volume status, some patients with hypernatremia may improve with simple oral intake, while others may require further fluid management (and treatment of the underlying cause of the hypernatremia).

about.formula_en:
Free water deficit = % total body water, fraction × weight, kg × (current Na / ideal Na – 1)

where % total body water (TBW) is:

  • Adult male: 60% (i.e., use 0.6 in the equation)
  • Adult female: 50% (0.5)
  • Elderly male: 50% (0.5)
  • Elderly female: 45% (0.45)
  • Child: 60% (0.6)

creator_info.about_en: Nicolaos E. Madias, MD, is the chair of the department of medicine at the St. Elizabeth's Medical Center in Boston, Massachusetts. He is also a professor of medicine, specializing in Nephrology, at the Tufts University School of Medicine. Dr. Madias has co-authored over 100 articles published in peer reviewed journals.
